work.name: Imaging and Vision Laboratory (IVL), Department of Informatics, Systems and Communication, University of Milano-Bicocca
work.summary: Working on the AdvaNced Technologies for Human-centrEd Medicine (ANTHEM) project of the Piano Nazionale Complementare (PNC).
highlights: Signal Processing (Time Series, EEG, ECG, EMG, Images, Videos)

work.name: Database Systems Group (DBS), Faculty of Engineering, Free University of Bozen-Bolzano
work.summary: Worked on the Interconnected Nord-Est Innovation Ecosystem (iNEST) project of the Piano Nazionale di Ripresa e Resilienza (PNRR).

work.name: Applied Computational Logic and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (ACLAI), Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Ferrara
work.summary: Coordinated many theses with keen students receiving excellent feedback. Some of these works have been published in international journals and conferences.
highlights: (Fuzzy) Modal Logic and Interval Temporal Logic

work.name: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Ferrara

volunteer.organization: Associazione Dottorandi e Dottori di Ricerca in Italia (ADI)
highlights: Obtained a deserved 3-months scholarship extension for all PhD students at the national level during the COVID-19 period.
Managed to remove the taxes of all PhD students of the University of Ferrara after a discussion with the (new) Rector.

volunteer.organization: Department Council (Consiglio di Dipartimento), Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Ferrara
Academic Board (Collegio Docenti), PhD in Mathematics, Universities of Ferrara, Modena-Reggio Emilia, and Parma
volunteer.position: 35th cycle PhDs' Representative (Rappresentante dei Dottorandi del 35° ciclo)

volunteer.organization: Quality Assurance Commission (Commissione Assicurazione Qualità), Department of Mathematics, Computer Science, and Physics, University of Udine
highlights: Bachelor's Degree in Internet of Things, Big Data and Web
International Master's Degree in Computer Science (joint collaboration with the University of Klagenfurt)

awards.title: Erasmus+ Scholarship
awards.awarder: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Ferrara, Italy
awards.summary: Awarded a 5-month full scholarship through the Erasmus+ program and spent the duration of the scholarship in Murcia, Spain.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
